It‚Äôs something many parents don‚Äôt and won‚Äôt do, and the proliferation of ads for it just makes me want to do it even less. It smacks of cheesy marketing scam. The information really dumbs down things and makes me feel like I‚Äôm in the wrong, non-scientific app geared to airheads. I don‚Äôt know many women I consider airheads, so I really don‚Äôt know who this is for. Also topics like ‚Äúare sit-ups safe?‚Äù are sorely misinformed. Sure, yes of course they‚Äôre safe for the baby up to a point at which sure there‚Äôs a minor risk of reducing blood flow while on one‚Äôs back.
